abilities.name: Damage Bind
abilities.text: Each Pokémon that has any damage counters on it (both yours and your opponent's) can't use any Poké-Powers.

attacks.name: Gigavolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Reflect Energy
attacks.text: Move an Energy card attached to Ampharos to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

abilities.name: Dig Well
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top 3 cards of your deck, choose as many Water Energy cards as you like, and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Discard the other cards. This power can't be used if Blastoise is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Aqua Press
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to all Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Double Launcher
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to Blastoise. Choose 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 60 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Blastoise can't use Double Launcher during your next turn.

abilities.name: Fire Breath
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon. That Pokémon is now Burned. This power can't be used if Blaziken is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Clutch
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to Blaziken.

abilities.name: Power Circulation
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your discard pile for up to 2 basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put those cards on top of your deck in any order. If you do, put 2 damage counters on Delcatty. This power can't be used if Delcatty is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Power Heal
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Delcatty. Then, remove 2 damage counters from Delcatty.

cards.name: Dialga

abilities.name: Reverse Time
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Dialga from your hand onto your Bench, you may search your discard pile for up to 3 in any combination of Pokémon (excluding Pokémon LV.X) and basic Energy cards. Show them to your opponent and put them on top of your deck in any order.

cards.text: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.

attacks.name: Time-Space Traveling
attacks.text: Draw cards until you have 7 cards in your hand.

cards.name: Dialga

abilities.name: Time Aura
abilities.text: As long as Dialga is your Active Pokémon, your opponent can't play any Pokémon from his or her hand to evolve his or her Active Pokémon.

cards.text: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.

attacks.name: Metal Burn
attacks.text: Discard all Metal Energy attached to Dialga.

attacks.name: Deafen
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Trainer cards or Stadium cards from his or her hand during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Second Strike
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has 2 or more damage counters on it, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.

abilities.name: Psychic Connect
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Psychic Energy attached to 1 of your Benched Pokémon to your Active Pokémon. This power can't be used if Gardevoir is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Energy Burst
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Gardevoir and the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psychic Protection
attacks.text: Gardevoir has no Weakness during your opponent's next turn.

abilities.name: Let Loose
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Giratina from your hand onto your Bench, you may use this power. Each player shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck and draws up to 4 cards. (You draw your cards first.)

attacks.name: Earth Power
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Over Slash
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon).

attacks.name: Dark Wing Flaps
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at the card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

abilities.name: Electric Barrier
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to your Benched Pokémon (excluding any Manectric) by attacks.

attacks.name: Power Wave
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to each Pokémon that has any Poké-Powers (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Attract Current
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Splashing Turn
attacks.text: You may switch Palkia G with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Pearl Breath
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Iron Skull
abilities.text: Rampardos's attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Head Smash
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon would be Knocked Out by this attack, Rampardos does 40 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Mold Breaker
attacks.text: Any damage done to Rampardos by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance) until the end of your next turn.

cards.name: Shaymin
cards.text: It lives in flower patches and avoids detection by curling up to look like a flowering plant.

attacks.name: Flower Aroma
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Shaymin. The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Damage Aid
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 30 damage plus 50 more damage. Then, remove all Special Conditions from the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Shaymin
cards.text: The flowers all over its body burst into bloom if it is lovingly hugged and senses gratitude.

attacks.name: Growth
attacks.text: Attach a Grass Energy card from your hand to Shaymin.

attacks.name: Air Slash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard an Energy attached to Shaymin.

cards.name: Slaking

abilities.name: Lazy Paunch
abilities.text: If Slaking used any attacks during your last turn, Slaking can't attack.

cards.text: The world's laziest Pokémon. When it is lounging, it is actually saving energy for striking back.

attacks.name: Best Dash
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Slaking by attacks is increased by 50 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Pokémon SP and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Team Attack
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Pokémon SP you have in play.

attacks.name: Midnight Eyes
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Perish Song
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Asleep and was damaged or affected by Midnight Eyes during your last turn, the Defending Pokémon is Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Healing Song
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon.

abilities.name: Temper Tantrum
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard as many cards as you like from your hand. If you do, put that many damage counters on Banette. This power can't be used if Banette is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Darkness Switch
attacks.text: Discard an Energy card attached to Banette, and then switch all damage counters on Banette with those on the Defending Pokémon. (If an effect of this attack is prevented, this attack does nothing.)

attacks.name: Loneliness
attacks.text: You may show your hand to your opponent. If you do and if you don't have any Pokémon in your hand, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

abilities.name: Metal Trait
abilities.text: As long as Bastiodon has a Pokémon Tool attached to it, remove 1 damage counter from Bastiodon between turns.

attacks.name: Iron Defense
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Bastiodon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Iron Tackle
attacks.text: Bastiodon does 30 damage to itself.

cards.name: Beautifly
cards.text: Despite its looks, it is aggressive. It jabs with its long, thin mouth if disturbed while collecting pollen.

attacks.name: Colorful Powder
attacks.text: If Beautifly has 2 or less Energy attached to it, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. If Beautifly has 3 Energy attached to it, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned and Poisoned. If Beautifly has 4 or more Energy attached to it, this attack does 20 damage plus 40 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep, Burned, and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Silver Scale
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Resistance, this attack's base damage is 60 damage instead of 30.

abilities.name: Nurse Call
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a card from your hand. If you do, remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon. You can't use more than 1 Nurse Call Poké-Power each turn. This power can't be used if Blissey is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Return
attacks.text: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Double-edge
attacks.text: Blissey does 60 damage to itself.

cards.name: Dialga
cards.text: A legendary Pokémon of Sinnoh. It is said that time flows when Dialga's heart beats.

attacks.name: Energy Stream
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your discard pile for a basic Energy card and attach it to Dialga.

attacks.name: Diamond Blow
attacks.text: Dialga can't attack during your next turn.

abilities.name: Sinkhole
abilities.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon retreats, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Push Down
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Magnitude
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Camouflage Pattern
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Dustox by your opponent's Pokémon that is affected by 2 or more Special Conditions.

attacks.name: Smogscreen
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Chemical Scale
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Poké-Powers or Poké-Bodies, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned and Confused.

cards.name: Empoleon
cards.text: If anyone were to hurt its pride, it would slash them with wings that can cleave through an ice floe.

attacks.name: Knock Off
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it.

attacks.name: Jet Smash
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 70 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Empoleon can't use Jet Smash during your next turn.

cards.name: Giratina
cards.text: A Pokémon that is said to live in a world on the reverse side of ours. It appears in an ancient cemetery.

attacks.name: Strafe
attacks.text: You may switch Giratina with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Broken-space Blow
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Knocked Out by this attack, put the Defending Pokémon and all cards attached to in the Lost Zone instead of the discard pile.

cards.name: Giratina
cards.text: It was banished for its violence. It silently gazed upon the old world from the Distortion World.

attacks.name: Dragonbreath
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Golduck
cards.text: It is seen swimming dynamically and elegantly using its well-developed limbs and flippers.

attacks.name: Swim
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Water Energy attached to any of his or her Pokémon, you may do 30 damage to any 1 Benched Pokémon instead. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Water Slide
attacks.text: You may move all Energy cards attached to Golduck to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Wriggle
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each of your opponent's Pokémon. If that coin flip is heads, this attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Dwindling Wave
attacks.text: Does 100 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on Gyarados G.

cards.name: Infernape
cards.text: It uses unique fighting moves with fires on its hands and feet. It will take on any opponent.

attacks.name: Rushing Flames
attacks.text: Discard as many Fire Energy cards as you like attached to your Pokémon in play. Flip a coin for each Energy card you discarded. This attack does 80 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Infernape.

cards.name: Kricketune
cards.text: There is a village that hosts a contest based on the amazingly variable cries of this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Revenge Melody
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the number of Kricketot and Kricketune in your discard pile.

attacks.name: Bug Buzz
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Asleep, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage. Remove the Special Condition Asleep from the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Lickilicky
cards.text: The long tongue is always soggy with slobber. The saliva contains a solvent that causes numbness.

attacks.name: Harrumph
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Before doing damage, discard all Trainer cards attached to that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Body Press
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Cheerful Voice
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this power. If you do, your turn ends. During your next turn, each of Ludicolo's attacks does 60 more damage to the Defending Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). This power can't be used if Ludicolo is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Mad Dance
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Best Dance
attacks.text: After doing damage, remove from Ludicolo the number of damage counters equal to the damage you did to the Defending Pokémon. Ludicolo can't use Best Dance during your next turn.

cards.name: Luvdisc
cards.text: It lives in warm seas. It is said that a couple finding this Pokémon will be blessed with eternal love.

attacks.name: Love Call
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Search your deck for a Pokémon that is the same type as the Pokémon you chose, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Sweet Kiss
attacks.text: Your opponent may draw a card.

cards.name: Ninetales
cards.text: Its nine tails are said to be imbued with a mystic power. It can live for a thousand years.

attacks.name: Flame Bash
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. Search your deck for a number of basic Fire Energy cards up to the number of heads and attach them to any of your Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Mysterious Flames
attacks.text: If you have more Energy in play than your opponent, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned and Confused.

cards.name: Palkia
cards.text: A legendary Pokémon of Sinnoh. It is said that space becomes more stable with PALKIA's every breath.

attacks.name: Tsunami
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Water Pulse
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Shaymin
cards.text: It lives in flower patches and avoids detection by curling up to look like a flowering plant.

attacks.name: Energy Blow
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Shaymin.

attacks.name: Aromatherapy
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from each of your Pokémon.

cards.name: Torterra
cards.text: Some Pokémon are born on a TORTERRA's back and spend their entire life there.

attacks.name: Green Blast
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Grass Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Soothing Scent
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

abilities.name: Anticipation
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, excluding damage, done to Toxicroak G.

attacks.name: Deep Poison
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 20 damage plus 40 more damage.

abilities.name: Galactic Switch
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move an Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon SP to another of your Pokémon. Then, put 2 damage counters on Bronzong G. This power can't be used if Bronzong G is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Psychic Pulse
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Cacturne
cards.text: It becomes active at night, seeking prey that is exhausted from the day's desert heat.

attacks.name: Spike Wound
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. This attack does 50 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Poison Experiment
attacks.text: You may discard a Grass or Darkness Energy attached to Cacturne. If you discard a Grass Energy, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. If you discard a Darkness Energy, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Stretch Vine
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Carnivine.

attacks.name: Vine Extract
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned and Poisoned.

cards.name: Cascoon
cards.text: It never forgets any attack it endured while in the cocoon. After evolution, it seeks payback.

attacks.name: Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from Cascoon and put it onto Cascoon. (This counts as evolving Cascoon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Poison Thread
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Combusken
cards.text: Its kicking mastery lets it loose 10 kicks per second. It emits sharp cries to intimidate foes.

attacks.name: Firebreathing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

cards.name: Cranidos
cards.text: A lifelong jungle dweller from 100 million years ago, it would snap obstructing trees with head butts.

attacks.name: Rock Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Knock Over
attacks.text: You may discard any Stadium card in play.

abilities.name: Flash Bite
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Crobat G from your hand onto your Bench, you may put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Toxic Fang
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on the Defending Pokémon between turns.

cards.name: Flaaffy
cards.text: If its coat becomes fully charged with electricity, its tail lights up. It fires hair that zaps on impact.

attacks.name: Spark
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Tail Code
attacks.text: Move an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon to another of your opponent's Pokémon.

cards.name: Grotle
cards.text: It knows where pure water wells up. It carries fellow Pokémon there on its back.

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from Grotle.

attacks.name: Black Cry
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat or use any Poké-Powers during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Dark Slash
attacks.text: You may discard a Darkness Energy attached to Houndoom G. If you do, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

cards.name: Kirlia
cards.text: If its Trainer becomes happy, it overflows with energy, dancing joyously while spinning about.

attacks.name: Teleportation Burst
attacks.text: You may switch Kirlia with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Lombre
cards.text: It has a mischievous spirit. If it spots an angler, it will tug on the fishing line to interfere.

attacks.name: Interrupt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, look at your opponent's hand and choose 1 card, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

cards.name: Lucario
cards.text: A well-trained one can sense auras to identify and take in the feelings of creatures over half a mile away.

attacks.name: Aura Sphere
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Do the Wave
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each of your Benched Pokémon.

abilities.name: Cold Feet
abilities.text: If Mightyena is affected by a Special Condition, ignore all Energy necessary to use Mightyena's attacks.

attacks.name: Collude
attacks.text: If you played any Supporter card from your hand during this turn, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Desperate Attack
attacks.text: If Mightyena has less Energy attached to it than the Defending Pokémon, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage.

cards.name: Mismagius
cards.text: Its cry sounds like an incantation. It is said the cry may rarely be imbued with happiness-giving power.

attacks.name: Upper Hand
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Monferno
cards.text: It skillfully control the intensity of the fire on its tail to keep its foes at an ideal distance.

attacks.name: Fire Tail Slap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy attached to Monferno.

attacks.name: Paralyzing Gaze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

abilities.name: Sludge Cell
abilities.text: If Muk remains affected by any Special Conditions between turns, remove 2 damage counters from Muk.

attacks.name: Strange Poison
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. If tails, Muk is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Strange Sludge
attacks.text: If Muk is Poisoned, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Octillery
cards.text: It loves to lurk inside holes in rocks. It sometimes sprays ink on prey by sticking out only its mouth.

attacks.name: Water Vein
attacks.text: Reveal the top 5 cards of your deck. Flip a coin for each Energy card you find there. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads. Shuffle the revealed cards back into your deck.

attacks.name: Octazooka
attacks.text: Any time the Defending Pokémon tries to attack, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing. (If the Defending Pokémon is no longer your opponent's Active Pokémon, this effect ends.)

cards.name: Prinplup
cards.text: Because every PRINPLUP considers itself to be the most important, they can never form a group.

attacks.name: Bubblebeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Probopass
cards.text: It freely controls three small units called Mini-Noses using magnetic force.

attacks.name: Stealth Rock
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Shed Skin
attacks.text: Remove 4 damage counters from Seviper.

attacks.name: Bite and Escape
attacks.text: You may switch Seviper with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Paralyze Poison
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

cards.name: Shieldon
cards.text: It is outstandingly armored. As a result, it can eat grass and berries without having to fight.

attacks.name: Endure
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, if Shieldon would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, Shieldon is not Knocked Out and its remaining HP becomes 10 instead.

attacks.name: Rock Slide
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Silcoon
cards.text: It wraps silk around the branches of a tree. It drinks rainwater on its silk while awaiting evolution.

attacks.name: Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from Silcoon and put it onto Silcoon. (This counts as evolving Silcoon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Sticky String
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Vigoroth
cards.text: Its heart beats at a tenfold tempo, so it cannot sit still even for a moment.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Vigoroth does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Fight Back
attacks.text: If Vigoroth has any damage counters on it, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.

cards.name: Wartortle
cards.text: It is said to live 10,000 years. Its furry tail is popular as a symbol of longevity.

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Rocket Tackle
attacks.text: Wartortle does 10 damage to itself. Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Wartortle by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

abilities.name: Thick Skin
abilities.text: Zangoose can't be affected by any Special Conditions.

attacks.name: Invite and Strike
attacks.text: Switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to the new Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Chop Up
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Cacnea
cards.text: By storing water in its body, this desert dweller can survive 30 days without water.

attacks.name: Sneaky Attack
attacks.text: If Cacnea has any Darkness Energy attached to it, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Shoot Needle
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and this attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can choose the same Pokémon more than once, but you can't do more than 10 damage to that Pokémon in this way.)

cards.name: Carnivine
cards.text: It binds itself to trees in marshes. It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling drool and gulps them down.

attacks.name: Poison Breath
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Sweet Saliva
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from each of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Chansey
cards.text: A kindly Pokémon that lays highly nutritious eggs and shares them with injured Pokémon or people.

attacks.name: Healing Trial
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, remove 3 damage counters from Chansey. If tails, remove 3 damage counters from the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Pulled Punch
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack's base damage is 10 instead of 40.

cards.name: Chimchar
cards.text: It is very agile. Before going to sleep, it extinguishes the flame on its tail to prevent fires.

cards.name: Combee
cards.text: The trio is together from birth. It constantly gathers honey from flowers to please VESPIQUEN.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Shoot Through
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Diglett
cards.text: A Pokémon that lives underground. Because of its dark habitat, it is repelled by bright sunlight.

attacks.name: Dig Under
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

attacks.name: Trip Over
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

cards.name: Dunsparce
cards.text: It digs into the ground with its tail and makes a mazelike nest. It can fly just a little.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Spring Out
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Electrike
cards.text: Using electricity stored in its fur, it stimulates its muscles to heighten its reaction speed.

attacks.name: Roar
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thunder Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Grimer
cards.text: It was born when sludge in a dirty stream was exposed to the moon's X-rays. It appears among filth.

attacks.name: Division
attacks.text: Search your deck for Grimer and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Poison Gas
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Happiny

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Chansey from your hand onto Happiny (this counts as evolving Happiny) and remove all damage counters from Happiny.

cards.text: It likes to carry around a small rock. It may wander around others' feet and cause them to stumble.

attacks.name: Hospitality
attacks.text: Switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. Remove 2 damage counters from the new Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Honcho's Command
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 in any combination of Stadium cards or Trainer cards that has Team Galactic's Invention in its name, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Target Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. If that Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Kricketot
cards.text: Its legs are short. Whenever it stumbles, its stiff antennae clack with a xylophone-like sound.

attacks.name: Lullaby
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Lapras
cards.text: It loves crossing the sea with people and Pokémon on its back. It understands human speech.

attacks.name: Grind
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the amount of Energy attached to Lapras.

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Lickitung
cards.text: When it extends its over-six-foot-long tongue, its tail quivers. There is a possibility they are connected.

attacks.name: Stretch Tongue
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

attacks.name: Knock Off
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it.

cards.name: Lotad
cards.text: It looks like an aquatic plant and serves as a ferry to Pokémon that can't swim.

attacks.name: Energy Ball
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Lotad but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Synthesis
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Grass Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Mareep
cards.text: Its fluffy coat swells to double when static electricity builds up. Touching it can be shocking.

attacks.name: Minor Errand-Running
attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Expand
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Mareep by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Misdreavus
cards.text: A Pokémon that startles people in the middle of the night. It gathers fear as its energy.

attacks.name: Take Back
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your discard pile for a Trainer card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand.

cards.name: Nosepass
cards.text: When endangered, it may protect itself by raising its magnetism and drawing iron objects to its body.

attacks.name: Pull
attacks.text: Switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Piplup
cards.text: A poor walker, it often falls down. However, its strong pride makes it puff up its chest without a care.

attacks.name: Muddy Water
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Poochyena
cards.text: A Pokémon with persistent nature, it chases its prey until the prey becomes exhausted.

attacks.name: Howl
attacks.text: Search your deck for Poochyena and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Psyduck
cards.text: Overwhelmed by enigmatic abilities, it suffers a constant headache. It sometimes uses mysterious powers.

attacks.name: Headache
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't play any Trainer, Supporter, or Stadium cards from his or her hand during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Latent Power
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does no damage to the Defending Pokémon. Instead, Psyduck is now Confused.

attacks.name: Chip Off
attacks.text: If your opponent has 6 or more cards in his or her hand, discard a number of cards without looking until your opponent has 5 cards left in his or her hand.

attacks.name: Poor Sleep
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage and Purugly G is now Asleep.

cards.name: Ralts
cards.text: If its horns capture the warm feelings of people or Pokémon, its body warms up slightly.

attacks.name: Future Sight
attacks.text: Look at the top 5 cards in either player's deck and put them back on top of that player's deck in any order.

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Remoraid
cards.text: It forcefully squirts water. The water jet never misses prey even if the REMORAID is deep in the sea.

attacks.name: Trickle
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Riolu
cards.text: It has the peculiar power of being able to see emotions such as joy and rage in the form of waves.

attacks.name: Steady Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

cards.name: Shuppet
cards.text: It loves vengeful emotions and hangs in rows under the eaves of houses where vengeful people live.

attacks.name: Hypnotic Gaze
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Fade Out
attacks.text: Return Shuppet and all cards attached to it to your hand. (If you don't have any Benched Pokémon, this attack does nothing.)

cards.name: Skitty
cards.text: It can't stop itself from chasing moving things, and it runs in a circle, chasing its own tail.

attacks.name: Heal Bell
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Skitty does 10 damage to itself.

abilities.name: Poison Structure
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have a Stadium card in play, you may use this power. Each Active Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) (excluding Pokémon SP) is now Poisoned. This power can't be used if Skuntank is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Slakoth
cards.text: It spends nearly all its time in a day sprawled out. Just seeing it makes one drowsy.

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Slakoth.

attacks.name: Slack Off
attacks.text: Remove all damage counters from Slakoth. Slakoth can't attack during your next turn.

cards.name: Squirtle
cards.text: It shelters itself in its shell, then strikes back with spouts of water at every opportunity.

cards.name: Swablu
cards.text: It can't relax if it or its surroundings are not clean. It wipes off dirt with its wings.

attacks.name: Sing
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Run Around
attacks.text: You may switch Swablu with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Tauros
cards.text: Once it takes aim at its foe, it makes a headlong charge. It is famous for its violent nature.

attacks.name: Show Off
attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Tauros does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Torchic
cards.text: A fire burns inside, so it feels very warm to hug. It launches fireballs of 1,800 degrees F.

attacks.name: Focus Energy
attacks.text: During your next turn, Torchic's Fire Shard attack's base damage is 80.

attacks.name: Fire Shard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Torkoal
cards.text: It burns coal inside its shell for energy. It blows out black soot if it is endangered.

attacks.name: Super Singe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Flame Ball
attacks.text: Move an Energy card attached to Torkoal to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Turtwig
cards.text: The shell on its back is made of soil. On a very healthy TURTWIG, the shell should feel moist.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Vulpix
cards.text: It controls balls of fire. As it grows, its six tails split from their tips to make more tails.

attacks.name: Reheat
attacks.text: Discard up to 2 Energy cards from your hand. For each card you discarded, draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Wurmple
cards.text: Often targeted by bird Pokémon, it desperately resists by releasing poison from its tail spikes.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Broken Time-Space
cards.text: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.,Each player may evolve a Pokémon that he or she just played or evolved during that turn.

cards.name: Cyrus's Conspiracy
cards.text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.,Search your deck for a Supporter card, a basic Energy card, and a Trainer card that has Team Galactic's Invention in its name, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Galactic HQ
cards.text: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.,Whenever any player plays any Pokémon from his or her hand to evolve his or her Pokémon, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.

cards.name: Level Max
cards.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Pokémon LV.X that levels up from 1 of your Pokémon, and put it onto that Pokémon. (This counts as leveling up that Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Life Herb
cards.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your Pokémon, and remove all Special Conditions and 6 damage counters from that Pokémon (all if there are less than 6).

cards.name: Looker's Investigation
cards.text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.,Look at your opponent's hand, then choose you or your opponent. That player shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck and draws up to 5 cards.

cards.name: Memory Berry
cards.text: Attach Memory Berry to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If that Pokémon is Knocked Out, discard this card.,The Pokémon this card is attached to can use any attack from its Basic Pokémon or its Stage 1 Evolution card. (You still have to pay for that attack's Energy cost.)

cards.name: Miasma Valley
cards.text: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.,Whenever any player puts a Basic Pokémon (excluding Grass or Psychic Pokémon) from his or her hand onto his or her Bench, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.

cards.name: PlusPower
cards.text: Attach PlusPower to 1 of your Pokémon. Discard this card at the end of your turn.,If the Pokémon PlusPower is attached to attacks, the attack does 10 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Poké Ball
cards.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Pokédex HANDY910is
cards.text: Look at the top 2 cards of your deck, choose 1 of them, and put it into your hand. Put the other card on the bottom of your deck.

cards.name: Pokémon Rescue
cards.text: Search your discard pile for a Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand.

cards.name: Team Galactic's Invention G-101 Energy Gain
cards.text: Attach Team Galactic's Invention G-101 Energy Gain to 1 of your Pokémon SP that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If that Pokémon is Knocked Out, discard this card. When the Pokémon this card is attached to is no longer a Pokémon SP, discard this card.,As long as Team Galactic's Invention G-101 Energy Gain is attached to a Pokémon, the attack cost of that Pokémon's attacks is Colorless less.

cards.name: Team Galactic's Invention G-103 Power Spray
cards.text: You may play this card during your opponent's turn when your opponent's Pokémon uses any Poké-Power. Prevent all effects of that Poké-Power. (This counts as that Pokémon using its Poké-Power.) If you have 2 or less Pokémon SP in play, you can't play this card.

cards.name: Team Galactic's Invention G-105 Poké Turn
cards.text: Return 1 of your Pokémon SP and all cards attached to it to your hand.

cards.name: Armor Fossil

abilities.name: Armor Stone
abilities.text: Whenever Armor Fossil would be damaged by your opponent's attack, flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, reduce that damage by 10.

cards.text: Play Armor Fossil as if it were a Colorless Basic Pokémon. (Armor Fossil counts as a Trainer card as well, but if Armor Fossil is Knocked Out, this counts as a Knocked Out Pokémon.) Armor Fossil can't be affected by any Special Conditions and can't retreat. At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Armor Fossil from play. (This doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon.)

cards.name: Skull Fossil

abilities.name: Skull Stone
abilities.text: During your opponent's turn, if Skull Fossil would be Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, put 1 damage counter on the Attacking Pokémon.

cards.text: Play Skull Fossil as if it were a Colorless Basic Pokémon. (Skull Fossil counts as a Trainer card as well, but if Skull Fossil is Knocked Out, this counts as a Knocked Out Pokémon.) Skull Fossil can't be affected by any Special Conditions and can't retreat. At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Skull Fossil from play. (This doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon.)

cards.name: Rainbow Energy
cards.text: Attach Rainbow Energy to 1 of your Pokémon. While in play, Rainbow Energy provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time. (Has no effect other than providing Energy.) When you attach this card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon.

cards.name: Dialga G LV.X

abilities.name: Time Crystal
abilities.text: Each Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) (excluding Pokémon SP) can't use any Poké-Bodies.

cards.text: Put this card onto your Active Dialga G. Dialga G LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

attacks.name: Remove Lost
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, remove an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon and put it in the Lost Zone.

cards.name: Drapion LV.X

abilities.name: Tri-Poison
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon. That Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 3 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns. This power can't be used if Drapion is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: Put this card onto your Active Drapion. Drapion LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

attacks.name: Sniping Tail
attacks.text: Does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Giratina LV.X

abilities.name: Invisible Tentacles
abilities.text: Whenever your opponent's Pokémon tries to attack, your opponent discards 1 card from his or her hand. (If your opponent can't discard 1 card, your opponent's Pokémon can't attack.) You can't use more than 1 Invisible Tentacles Poké-Body each turn.

cards.text: Put this card onto your Active Giratina. Giratina LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

attacks.name: Darkness Lost
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) If any of your opponent's Pokémon would be Knocked Out by damage from this attack, put that Pokémon and all cards attached to it in the Lost Zone instead of discarding it.

cards.name: Palkia G LV.X

abilities.name: Lost Cyclone
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this power. Any player who has 4 or more Benched Pokémon chooses 3 of his or her Benched Pokémon. Put the other Benched Pokémon and all cards attached to them in the Lost Zone. (You choose your Pokémon first.) This power can't be used it Palkia G is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: Put this card onto your Active Palkia G. Palkia G LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

attacks.name: Hydro Shot
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to Palkia G. Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 80 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Shaymin LV.X

abilities.name: Thankfulness
abilities.text: Each of your Grass Pokémon (excluding any Shaymin) gets +40 HP. You can't use more than 1 Thankfulness Poké-Body each turn.

cards.text: Put this card onto your Active Shaymin. Shaymin LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

attacks.name: Seed Flare
attacks.text: Choose as many Grass Energy cards from your hand as you like and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. If you do, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage for each Grass Energy attached in this way.

cards.name: Shaymin LV.X

abilities.name: Revenge Seed
abilities.text: If any of your Grass Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during his or her last turn, each of Shaymin's attacks does 60 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: Put this card onto your Active Shaymin. Shaymin LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

attacks.name: Energy Flare
attacks.text: You may move any number of Energy cards attached to your Pokémon to your other Pokémon in any way you like.

cards.name: Electabuzz
cards.text: It loves to feed on strong electricity. It occasionally appears around large power plants and so on.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Thunderpunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage. If tails, Electabuzz does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Hitmonchan
cards.text: The spirit of a pro boxer has infused this POKéMON. It throws punches that are faster than a bullet train.

cards.name: Scyther
cards.text: It tears and shreds prey with its wickedly sharp scythes. It very rarely spreads its wings to fly.

attacks.name: Swords Dance
attacks.text: During your next turn, Scyther's Slash attack's base damage is 60.

abilities.name: Swift Swim
abilities.text: If Lotad has any Water Energy attached to it, Lotad's Retreat Cost is 0.

attacks.name: Blot
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from Lotad.

attacks.name: Jump On
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Roost
attacks.text: Remove 4 damage counters from Swablu. Swablu can't retreat during your next turn.

attacks.name: Mirror Move
attacks.text: If Swablu was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does the same amount of damage done to Swablu to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Find Wildfire
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Fire Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them in your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Brushfire
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Grass Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Inflame
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy card from your hand. (If you can't discard a card from your hand, this attack does nothing.)
